__DISCLAIMER__: CRITICAL: This is a template. Pesticide recommendations are highly regulated and depend on local laws, soil, climate, and pest resistance. The dosages provided are illustrative. ALWAYS consult a local agricultural extension officer or certified agronomist before applying any chemical. Use at your own risk.

Bacterial Spot.notes: Combination spray is most effective. Apply preventatively before rain.

Early Blight.notes: Systemic fungicide. Alternate with protectants like Mancozeb.

Late Blight.notes: Very serious disease. Apply preventatively, especially in cool, wet weather.

Leaf Mold.notes: Ensure good air circulation. This is common in greenhouses.

Septoria Leaf Spot.notes: Apply preventatively. Remove and destroy lowest infected leaves.

Spider Mites Two Spotted Spider Mite.notes: Miticides are required. Spray underside of leaves. Neem oil can be used for low infestations.

Target Spot.notes: A systemic fungicide. Rotate with protectant fungicides.

Tomato Yellowleaf Curl Virus.notes: NO CURE for virus. This pesticide is to control the Whiteflies that SPREAD the virus.

Tomato Mosaic Virus.notes: ACTION: Immediately remove and destroy infected plants. Wash hands and tools with soap.

Insect Pest Disease.notes: Systemic insecticide for sucking pests like Leaf Hoppers and Aphids.

Leaf Spot Disease.notes: Systemic fungicide for fungal leaf spots.

Wilt Disease.notes: Helps manage Bacterial Wilt. Drench the soil at the base of the plants.
